{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524037,"name":"","username":"Keller","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/keller/{size}/259062_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T21:48:32.982Z","cooked":"

Hi, we looked at this section in the manual:

IMG-20250211-WA00261080×326 58.8 KB

And we didn’t fully understand if the robot need to start fully behind the starting line or if the edge of the bumpers need to be above the line.
Does someone know the answer?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-11T21:48:32.982Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":80.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491250,"topic_slug":"robot-starting-configuration","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66859,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-starting-configuration/491250/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3524039,"name":"RockRGI","username":"RockRGI","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rockrgi/{size}/251644_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T21:52:55.264Z","cooked":"

I am not an official, but in years past this rule was in place and as long as your bumper was across the line you were good. Asking in the Q&A would be best if you need an official answer.

It would be, but you’ll just be referred to Q28.

Thank you!
The conclusion is that only the edge of the robot need to touch the starting line.
